title: Appeal to circuit court
context: §286-129 Appeal to circuit court. Any applicant who has been refused a license after at least three examinations, or who has been refused any examination, and every licensee whose license has been suspended, revoked, or canceled by the examiner of drivers, may appeal from such refusal, suspension, revocation, or cancellation to the circuit court of the circuit in which the applicant or licensee resides by filing a notice of appeal in such court within thirty days after being notified of the refusal, suspension, revocation, or cancellation. The appeal shall not operate as a stay to the order or decision appealed from. The appeal shall be subject to such procedure and rules as may be prescribed by the court and the decision of the court shall be final except as otherwise provided in chapter 91. [L 1937, c 234, §26; RL 1945, §7327; RL 1955, §160-59; am L 1965, c 96, §100; HRS §286-129; am L 1970, c 164, §3] Rules of Court Appeal, see HRCP rule 72.
